qas.question: When were the styles of arts created?
Who wrote Lives of the Most Excellent Painters, Sculptors, and Architects?
By the 18th century which languages was Vasaris book translated in?
In Vitruvius's mind, whose responsibility was it to see the principles carried out?
What did Leon Battista Alberti consider most important for beauty?
What ideal proportion did Alberti promote?
In what century did "style" as an artistic concept arise?
What was created in the 17th century?
Who wrote Lives of the Least Excellent Painters, Sculptors, and Architects?
By the 16th century which languages was Vasaris book translated in?
In Vitruvius's mind, whose responsibility was it to see the principles rejected?

context: According to Vitruvius, the <a3_0><b11_0>architect<b11_0/><a3_0/> should strive to fulfill each of these three attributes as well as possible. <a4_0><b12_0>Leon Battista Alberti<b12_0/><a4_0/>, who elaborates on the ideas of Vitruvius in his treatise, De Re Aedificatoria, saw beauty primarily as a matter of <a5_0>proportion<a5_0/>, although ornament also played a part. For Alberti, the rules of proportion were those that governed the idealised human figure, <a6_0>the Golden mean<a6_0/>. The most important aspect of beauty was therefore an inherent part of an object, rather than something applied superficially; and was based on universal, recognisable truths. The notion of <b8_0>style in the arts<b8_0/> was not developed until the <a0_0><a7_0>16th<a7_0/> century<a0_0/>, with the writing of <a1_0><b9_0>Vasari<b9_0/><a1_0/>: by the 18th century, his Lives of the Most Excellent Painters, Sculptors, and Architects had been translated into <a2_0><b10_0>Italian, French, Spanish and English<b10_0/><a2_0/>.
